newsitem.title: USA: AOL jumps on Cowen upgrade, bullish view.
newsitem.headline: AOL jumps on Cowen upgrade, bullish view.

text.p: America Online Inc shares jumped after a Cowen & Co analyst upgraded the online services provider to buy from neutral, with a 12-month price target of $55, saying he has "unwavering enthusiasm for the AOL story."

Jamie Kiggen of Cowen said that AOL his investment thesis rests upon the belief that investors will increasingly recognize its ability to sustain subscriber growth, increase its non-subscription revenues, become cash-flow positive and achieve profitability over the next few quarters.
AOL shares jumped 2-5/8 to 35-1/4 in very active trading.

Kiggen said that he believes AOL's recent hiring of Bob Pittman to lead the company's core services business was a positive move because Pittman appears to have the experience and insight needed to help AOL chairman Steve Case "achieve his vision of the new AOL."

Kiggen also said that company's new flat-rate pricing of $19.95 a month should have an immediate effect on a number of key business measures, especially subscriber growth. Kiggen said that his price target of $55 assumes a 2.8 revenue multiple on calendar 1997 revenues, a multiple that he said is just below where PSINet Inc and media companies trade.
